Sad.translation: Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. (Qur'an 2:286)
O Turner of hearts, keep my heart firm upon Your religion. (Hadith)
Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I rely. (Qur'an 9:129)
O Allah, remove the hardship, O Lord of mankind, and heal me, for You are the Healer. (Hadith)
Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]. (Qur'an 7:126)
Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us. (Qur'an 9:40)
O Allah, make the Qur’an the spring of my heart, the light of my chest, the remover of my sadness, and the repeller of my anxiety. (Hadith)
And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger, but give good tidings to the patient. (Qur'an 2:155)
And He will remove their sorrow, and reward them for what they patiently endured. (Qur'an 76:12)

Grateful.translation: My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents. (Qur'an 27:19)
All praise is for Allah who gave us life after causing us to die, and to Him is the resurrection. (Hadith)
If you are grateful, I will surely increase you. (Qur'an 14:7)
All praise is for Allah in every circumstance. (Hadith)
My Lord, inspire me to be grateful for Your favors and to do righteous deeds. (Qur'an 46:15)
So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me. (Qur'an 2:152)
And whatever you have of favor – it is from Allah. (Qur'an 16:53)
O Allah, help me remember You, thank You, and worship You in the best manner. (Hadith)
And few of My servants are grateful. (Qur'an 34:13)
Our Lord, accept this from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing. (Qur'an 2:127)

Forgiveness.translation: My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of the merciful. (Qur'an 23:118)
Our Lord, forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds. (Qur'an 3:193)
O Allah, You are Most Forgiving, and You love forgiveness, so forgive me. (Hadith)
And forgive us our sins, and grant us protection from our wrongdoings. (Qur'an 3:16)
O my Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer. (Qur'an 71:28)
Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we forget or make a mistake. (Qur'an 2:286)
Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith, and put not in our hearts any resentment. (Qur'an 59:10)
O Allah, distance me from my sins as You have distanced the East from the West. (Hadith)
O Allah, wash away my sins with water, snow, and hail. (Hadith)
And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves, remember Allah and seek forgiveness for their sins. (Qur'an 3:135)

Angry.translation: I seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the accursed. (Hadith)
O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me, guide me, and grant me well-being. (Hadith)
Those who restrain anger and pardon the people – and Allah loves the doers of good. (Qur'an 3:134)
And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. (Qur'an 7:200)
O Allah, fill my heart with peace and patience, and remove from me anger and resentment. (Inspired by Hadith)
The strong person is not the one who can overpower others, but the strong one is he who controls himself when angry. (Hadith)
Whoever suppresses anger while being able to act upon it, Allah will fill his heart with contentment. (Hadith)
Indeed, Allah is with the patient. (Qur'an 2:153)
And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the righteous. (Qur'an 3:133)
O Allah, grant me patience and calmness in all matters. (Inspired by Hadith)
